args:
Finding the fact that they were able to return
from the border to the Halidom curious, Zena
seeks the help of Cleo and comrades from the
Halidom to investigate the interior of the castle.
After a search, the group finds a jewel left by
Alberius behind a hidden doorway.
What has you so restless, Zena?
Please say you have not found dust.\nI cannot abide dust!
Nothing so grand a problem, I fear.\nI am merely doing a bit of research.
Do you recall, Cleo, that day at the border?\nWhen we were spirited from the checkpoint\nall the way back to the Halidom?
Yes, and we all owe you our lives for it.
You employed a teleportation technique\nwhich only those rich in mana and skilled\nin its handling can use.

His Majesty King Alberius also possessed
the same technique, and busied himself on
the daily with transporting himself to all
manner of far-flung places.
Yes, but I fear my ability is\nfar more limited than his.
I am not proficient enough with the\ntechnique to be able to transport\neveryone to a specific location.
Then how did you do so at the border?!
It is difficult to explain, but as I chanted\nthe spell, I felt something akin to light\nbegin to shine out in my mind.
When I offered mana to that light,\nI was able to return us all home.
Yes, but one that felt similar to the feeling\nI had when I first came to this world.
I was able to come here without getting\nlost because a Sacred Shard lit my path.

And while the Sacred Shard in this castle
does not seem to possess such power,
I wonder if there is not something else
here which had the ability to guide us.
Ah, so that is why you have been\nconducting research on the Halidom.
That being the case, let's ask the others\nto help you in your quest!

We have any number of trustworthy friends
who would be all too happy to help with a
situation like this; I'll waste not a moment
more in calling for them.
...And so, I have gathered these three\nindividuals, all of whom possess\nconsiderable experience in searching.
If you're hunting for treasure,\nI'm your man!
I'm happy to help, too! With all of us on\nthe job, we'll find what you're looking for\nfaster than Ranzal can find a ham!
And I just LOVE the idea of finding some\nlost treasure right under my nose.
Thank you all so much for your help.
I sorted through the treasure vault once\nmore, but came away with nothing.
Yeah, I more or less searched the entire\ncastle and came up with bupkis.
This is more difficult than I expected.\nDo we truly not have any more clues,\nno matter how slight?
None, unfortunately. Perhaps I was\nmistaken from the outset.
Come on, we only just started this little\ntreasure hunt! It's way too soon to give up!
Well, I heard you all were busy\nlooking for something.
As it turns out, when I was investigating\nthe castle myself, I found a little spot\nwhich quite piqued my curiosity.
I figured it might have something to do\nwith what you're looking for, so I thought\nit best to come and let you know.
You must take us there at once!
It's a wall. How very fascinating.
Yes, but compared to those around it,\nthe design of this wall is subtly different.\nI believe it was erected after the others.
Whoa! You made a door appear\nin the middle of the wall!
A powerful spell was hiding this door.
Nice job. I could have looked for ages\nand never found something like this.
Yeah, but the door's locked. Don't suppose\nanybody has a magic key lying about?\nOr maybe a crowbar?
Step aside, one and all!\nWatch and behold!

To think, a hidden door inside the Halidom!
At last, the day has come! I've spent long
days polishing up my lockpicking skills,
and now they will avail me at last!
PLUS I'm totally sure my legendary knife\nis waiting just beyond this door... *sigh*
I cannot speak to your, er, legendary knife,\nbut if you can open this door, please do!
Okaaay, so we wiggle this pin here...\nInsert the jimmer in the jammer...\nAaaand...boom goes the catapult!
WELL?! Whatcha all standing around for?!\nLet's get in there and find my knife!
The light's coming from that pedestal\nin the center of the room.
Look how its colors shift and change...\nThough small, it is lovely beyond compare.
There's a seal engraved on the pedestal!\nHold on, let me read it...
＂I enshrine this jewel here as a beacon\nso all who inhabit this castle can ever\nfind their way home. —Alberius＂
I feel such a strong sense of hope when\nI touch the jewel. Truly, this served as a\nbeacon to guide us home.
It was because of His Majesty that we\nfound our way back... *sniff*
Thank you, Zena. I was able to remember\nHis Majesty once more because of you.
Now let us get this gem to the reference\nroom so we may study it in greater detail!
